intro: Biermannia quinquecallosa, commonly known as the five-ribbed biermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-lobed flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate with prominent veins and are often covered in fine hairs. Biermannia quinquecallosa is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display.
